characters: SHATTERING THE GLASS. DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HUGHIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an upscale living room. As we meet HUGHIE (20's, sligh kind). In a “BRYMAN AUDIO VISUAL” shirt. Installing someone's new TV. As well as their Blu-Ray. Sonos. Programming their Universal Remote. Hughie does it all. W see his FINGERS, dexterous and deft. He’s quite the tech virtuoso. MOMENTS LATER» He presents the BILL on a clipboard -- to WEST SIDE MOM in a New York Power Suit. She only half pay attention, as she returns work emails on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You sure? We’re running a special on Vimtag Security Cameras. HD. You can access ‘em from your phone.

dialogues.speaker: WEST SIDE MOM
dialogues.text: Thanks but no. I don’t think we really need ‘em. My nanny’s here all the time. Hughie just has one of those sincere, earnest faces. He n to the woman’s 7-YEAR-OLD in a HOMELANDER COSTUME, playin with his Dominican NANNY.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Course. And you got the Homelander watching over things. (off the Mom’s smile) But, you know, the Homelander can’t be everywhere at once. Neither can the cops. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or the nanny, for that matter. No, if we wanna keep an eye on our kids? That’s up to us. Even if we’re working long hours and late nights. Know what I mean? Mom looks up from her phone. Clearly a long hour worker.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Maybe you don’t need the cameras, but what about that one time you do? Is there such a thing as too safe? Off Hughie. Smiling warmly. Making the sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mom-and-Pop ELECTRONICS STORE. TV’s and STEREO EQUIPMEN on the shelves. Hughie behind the counter. As -- The bell over the door RINGS. ROBIN (20's, girl-next-door cute) enters. She sidles up to Hughie, as _if a customer

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sin? I want to schedule an appointment. For you to come over and -— (arches an eyebrow) Lay some cable.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Robin. That doesn’t mean what you think it means.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: ‘Laying cable’ means sex.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ‘Laying pipe’ means sex. ‘Laying cable’ means you want me to come to your house and take a shit.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (laughing) That’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hey, you said it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You ready yet? Despite your best efforts, I’m still hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN ON A BUS-STOP POSTER. A completely BLACK SUITED HERO a cologne ad. “BLACK NOIR for DRAKKAR NOIR.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Hughie and Robin, holding hands, walk down an empty SI STREET. She CHUCKLES at a story he just told --

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: «..SO you got her from ‘no thanks,’ to four cameras?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What can I say? I’m a good fucking salesman. (off Robin’s eye-roll) Hey, I got you, didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Barely! (beat) Speaking of, Mr. Salesman. Did you ask for the raise? Hughie takes a half-beat. He knows Robin isn’t going to l this, but plays it off, casually.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Gary was totally supportive <- he just says things are slow., Next year, though, for sure.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Okay. Hughie looks at her.) Feels guilty.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Go in there and kick his ass?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I said ‘okay.’

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: But you didn’t mean it. I see that look. C'mon, let’s hear it.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (sighs, alright) You’re the best guy there, by a long shot -- and Gary’s taking advantage of you -- and yeah, you should get in there and fight for it. This is banter, not bickering. A sign of how much they lo and are comfortable with, each other.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. I didn’t realize you needed a sugar daddy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Blow me. This is about you getting what you deserve. Hell, I’m killing myself at school cause it’s gonna pay off -- for both of us. I mean, if we’re moving in together -- Robin takes one step off the curb into the street, about cross. But Hughie stops on a dime.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Wait. What’d you just say?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: (breaks into a grin) Well, we can’t keep -- laying pipe -- at your parent’s place. Trying to keep quiet, staring up at that dumb Zeppelin poster.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (also grins) Hey. Don’t ever besmirch the Zeppelin poster. He’s still on the curb, she’s still one step in the stree As he leans forward and kisses her. Like none he’s ever h before -- or ever will again. Hughie steps back, holding both of Robin’s hands. They’re in love, then -- SMASH! Robin is suddenly, shockingly ATOMIZED before Hughie’s eyes. Blood and gummy bits of viscera spatter against Hughie’s face. Hughie still holds Robin’s hands. But that’s all he’s holding. They’re gory, detached. It happens so fast» Hughie doesn’t have time to react. As fast-running hero A-TRAIN skids to a stop. Robin’s insides all over his costumed outsides. He clutches a distinctive BLUE DUFFEL BAG tight to his chest. The motherfucker just ran right through Hughie’s girlfriend. A-Train is straight-up frightened. Jittery as hell. But n because of what he just did. Then why?

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: (sputtering) Oh God, I’m -- I’m sorry. But I can’t stop. I can’t stop. And with that, A-Train RACES away at supersonic speeds, leaving a blurred trail of motion in his wake. And leaving Hughie. Alone. Holding two bloody hands. In shock, he can’t let them go. Until some emotion -- some abject horror -- begins to seep in... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (a whisper) «+. R... Rob... WIDE SHOT. Down the street. Hughie is small in the frame. His voice distant, ragged, wrenching, as finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A generic Nissan Altima pulls up before a generic office park. STARLIGHT (20's, blonde, sweet, in a reasonably mod superhero outfit) climbs out of the passenger seat. She clutches a HEADSHOT, looks nervous. But not as nervous as her MOTHER. Who licks her finger, smooths out Starlight’s eyebrow. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER Whatever you do, don’t chew your thumbnail. And remember to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All beige, all the time. Water cooler burps. A table with sad, out of date PEOPLE magazine. Metal folding chairs occupied by a few exotically-garbed SUPERHEROINES. (Let’s play the clash between the mundane and the superheroic). Starlight enters, signs in. Nods at one of the other Superheroines, apparently no love lost.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Hey Countess.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTESS
dialogues.text: Starlight. Omigod. So good to see you. Is that a new headshot?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: No. Same one.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTESS
dialogues.text: It’s so nice. Countess gives a “I’m pretending to like you but I fuckin hate your guts” grin. Starlight smiles back, self-conscio From there, we enter a MONTAGE of Starlight’s bizarre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO CAMERA POV. It SNAPS to life. Focusing in on Starlight. Anxious. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please slate for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m, um, Starlight. 5 foot 8, 127 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Turn around please. She rotates, an awkward 360 degree turn. Then --

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s see it, dear.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: You should look away --

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Turn away from camera and shut your eyes. Or else I’1ll blind you.

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alright. Go ahead. Starlight concentrates -- it starts with her eyes, which white hot -- then the OVERHEAD FLUORESCENTS FLICKER and F as she draws energy from her nearby surroundings -- Until her EYES emit a J.J. Abrams-style, blazing LIGHT BU that explodes into the room -- The camera FREEZES and FRITZES and RATTLES at the concuss blast. When it resumes, it’s on its side, Starlight is crouching over someone just off camera, upset --

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: CASTING DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just fine, dear. Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight on the toilet. Clearly peeing. (You never see superheroes peeing!) Then she reaches beneath her, pulls the plastic urine test cup. Begins to label it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight sits at a POLYGRAPH. Wears sensors. A bland technician across from her, taking notes. (Fun fact: thes are real questions from CIA employee interviews. ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Have you ever plotted to overthrow the United States of America?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: No. The Technician inspects the answer. Mutters to himself. Betrays nothing. Starlight starts chewing her thumbnail.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: How do you feel when you see a small animal in distress?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Um. Bad.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Did you ever feel sexual urges when sitting in your parents’, lap?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: What? No. God. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO CAMERA POV. Starlight in the midst of an interview. She speaks with genuine heart.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: ...I was just... like most Super- Abled, I was born like this. My Mom was thrilled.) She made me go to all those little miss hero pageants. I hated it, I can still smell the hairspray. And at the Q and A, they always asked me my wish. And I always saidy “to save the world.” The judges chuckled, like it was cute. But it’s not a joke to me. Since when did ‘hopeful’ and ‘naive’ become the same thing? Why get into this business, if not to save the world? It’s all I’ve ever wanted. And it’s why all I’ve ever wanted was to be in the Seven... Off her pixelated video image... INT. ROBIN’S PARENTS’ APARTMENT - FEW DAYS LATER PHOTOS of ROBIN. Surrounded by thick FLOWER ARRANGEMENTS. A ROOMFUL of somber people in DARK SUITS, eating from sma plates. We notice a WOMAN crying into a MAN’s shoulder. Robin’s PARENTS. This is the post-funeral reception. Everyone stands close, united in grief. Except for -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hughie. Sits in the corner. Alone. In a suit and tie. He holds a plate with a square of ambrosia Jell-O salad on i CLOSE ON HUGHIE. A maelstrom of heartbreak, pain and emotion, beneath a numb shell. He looks up, sees -- POV. Two CHILDREN in nice clothes, sprawled before the TV Watching a “SEVEN” CARTOON. Even here, even now... most people are FANS... INT. HUGHIE’S FAMILY APARTMENT - QUEENS - DAY Hughie returns back to his FAMILY APARTMENT. Tie loosened His zaftig MOM follows, along with his wheezing FATHER (sallow, skinny, rolling an oxygen tank beside him). Dad thumps on the couch, flips on the TV. HUGHIE’S MOM Well, I thought it was“a lovely service. Just lovely. Hughie. What’s he supposed.to say? It was awesome? HUGHIE’S MOM Did you eat?, Can I -- fix you some pizza rolls?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ...I’m not hungry. HUGHIE’S MOM (noticing the TV) Oh, honey. Look. ON THE SCREEN. )Six o’clock news. A PRESS CONFERENCE. A- TRAIN. Beside VOUGHT VICE-PRESIDENT of HERO MANAGEMENT JU STILLWELL (40's). Hughie noticeably flinches at this.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: .».-and as you know, A-Train was placed on standard administrative leave until the NYPD could conduct their investigation. Which they’ve now concluded -- and have ruled no wrong-doing. But that doesn’t begin to convey the terrible regret we all feel at this awful, tragic loss...

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: My deepest condolences to Robin Ward’s family. I was chasing those bank robbers... and she just... stepped into the middle of the street... and I couldn’t... A-Train trails off, choked up. Golden Globe-worthy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hughie mutters to himself. Devastated.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Middle of the --? She was a half- step off the fucking curb. DING DONG! The door. Mom swings open the door, revealing a VOUGHT LAWYER -- DO FRIEDMAN. All Clinton-esque, lip-biting sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: Does a Hugh Campbell live here? INT. HUGHIE’S FAMILY APARTMENT - MINUTES LATER - NIGHT 10. A small stack of LEGAL DOCUMENTS on a TABLE. Hughie sits front of the lawyer. Scans the papers. Hughie’s Mom observes. Dad stillywatches TV in the back, seemingly catatonic, wheezing through»his nose tube.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: ...really, everyone at Vought is just... wrecked about Robin... (then, as a ‘friend’) Now. You two weren’t married and -- look, technically there’s no legal claim. But still, Vought wants to do the “right thing --,offer you 25 thousand in restitution. HUGHIE’S MOM (that’s life-changing) 25 thousand!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: It’s the least we could do, ma’am. You just need to sign -- here -- and I’1l hand over the check --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (reading, realizing) But this -- is a confidentiality agreement.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: It’s a boiler plate NDA --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I sign this, I can’t talk about it? Have to pretend it didn’t happen? That I wasn’t holding Robin’s arms in my hands?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: I know you’re upset, but we’re just trying to help -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Then say you’re sorry --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Hughie builds a head of steam --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You people say ‘condolences’ and ‘my regrets’ and ‘our sympathies,’ but no one can look me in the fucking eye and say “I’m sorry!” I’m not signing anything! Now get out! Doug Friedman pauses a beat, unsure. Hughie charges over him, ROUGHLY HAULS HIM OUT OF HIS SEAT!

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I said GET THE HELL OUT!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HUGHIE. Sitting quietly in his seat. That outbur was just in his imagination. There’s churning lava deep d inside him. But he’s not .a fighter. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: You okay? As I said, a boiler plate NDA, really pretty standard.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I’1l think about it.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: Hughie --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Let me think about it. Beat. Doug Friedman gives a smile. Reads the room.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: I get it. I’11 leave the document, gimme a ring if you have questions. (then) You keep the pen, okay? The LAWYER hands over a SILVER PEN labeled ‘VOUGHT.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We soar over countless versions of the same middle class house. Like some cloning experiment run horrifically amok THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA INT.

dialogues.speaker: BEST
dialogues.text: of a

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: ON A BOOKCASE. Loaded with TROPHIES. RIBBONS. “LITTLE SUPERSTAR - lst PLACE.” “SWEET CORN FESTIVAL & 5K RUN - OVERALL POWERS.” Etc. Along with a crowd of photos -- heavily made-up, Jon Benet-style Starlight, ages 4 thru 10, always jauntily posing, hands-on-hips, wearing a kid- sized, homemade version of her outfit. A shrine to a Mother’s pride in her daughter. In the adjacent kitchen -- Starlight herself, in her grow Superhero outfit, pours some Kraft Shells and Cheese into pot. Keeps one ear on a POLICE SCANNER, which babbles on about some local loitering and a nasty rash of graffiti. Her Mother enters -- listens briefly to the scanner -- STARLIGHT’S MOTHER Any maniacs out there?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Quiet night. Like every night. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER Too bad. We,could use the press right now. (sees,the pot, clucks) Oh, Annie, could you pack any more carbs into that? Apparently, Annie is her ‘secret identity’ name. When

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I’m hungry, Mother. And would you relax? I didn’t get the job. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER You don’t know that, you’re better than all of them. -- RING. RING. The phone. Mom goes to answer.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: They're auditioning nation-wide. Besides, Countess probably got it, she’s really good in a room. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER If you’re negative, negative things happen to you. (picks up phone) Hello? Um, I’m her Mother. Yes, yes, one moment. Mom holds out the phone, on pins and needles. Mouths “it’ them!” Starlight can’t help but feel a stab of butterflie Moves for the phone. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Hello? Yes, this is she. (then) I -- got it? I GOT IT?! STARLIGHT’S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: YOU GOT IT
dialogues.text: off this rambunctious, unbridled maternal ECSTASY -- INT. ROBIN’S PARENTS’ APARTMENT - NIGHT OPEN ON A FRAMED PHOTO in a much less happy home. ROBIN beaming beside her loving PARENTS. WIDER. Hughie sits at their kitchen table. Awkwardly shuffles notes and papers. In front of Robin’s Mom and Dad. Mom, red-rimmed eyes, on stares down at her folded hands.,»Dad also averts eye contact, impatiently taps his wedding »ring onto his beer bottle throughout. Clink. Clink.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ++.SO we can’t,file criminal charges against A-Train. Heroes are like cops, they can’t)be charged for collateral damage while in pursuit. Robin's Mom wipes away a tear. This is all a painful subject. Hughie continues --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: But -- but -- we can still file a civil suit. I found a lawyer -- he’1ll, work on percentage, won’t even charge us unless we win -- ROBIN’S DAD Hughie --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I just need you to jump in -- I’m not family, I can’t really sue by myself. But -- ROBIN’S DAD Hughie. Stop. We’re not suing anybody.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What? Why not? ROBIN’S DAD There’s no case. She was in the street. It’s the same as if she jay- walked and a bus hit her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: She was a half-step off the curb! Then Hughie spots it. On the table, right in front of the parents: another SILVER ‘VOUGHT’ PEN. The truth falls on Hughie like a ton of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Wait, were they -- did you sign? (silence speaks volumes) You took their money? Gene? Dad stops clinking the beer bottle. Searches Hughie’s fac ROBIN’S DAD How long have I known you, Hughie?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Since -- Robin and me were in high school. ROBIN’S DAD Prom night, actually. We met you, in that tux two sizes too big -- and there are some kids who just have that go-getter spark in their eye. (then) You were not one of those kids. (glancing at his wife) I'd say to her all the time, didn’t I? What’s Robin see in him? Got no drive, no fire, no fight. Boy doesn’t give a shit about anything.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I cared about your daughter. I’m trying to fight now. ROBIN’S DAD (raw) Too late. She’s dead. And you wanna drag out some court case? So we can relive her death? (hand on his wife) Yeah, we took the fucking money. And now we wanna -- try to -- put it all behind us.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: So what? A-Train just gets away with this? ROBIN’S DAD There’s no case, she was in the street! You let her step into the street. It’s not A-Train we blame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Hughie, as if absorbing a palpable body blow... THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie. Walking down the street. Despondent. Listening to a MESSAGE on his CELL --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hugh, this is Doug Friedman from Vought, just checking in. Look, I know the money can never make up for losing Robin. But we can make things a little easier for your family, if you’d -- Hughie CLICKS it off. Then strangely, we CUT TO -- A STILL CAMERA POV. From inside a car. SNAPPING PICS of Hughie. Clickclickclickclick. As he enters a bodega. Who's taking pictures? Off this mystery --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIXER of BUD LIGHT. Pulled from the fridge case by Hugh He’s on edge. An edge he goes plummeting right over when -- He pivots in the cramped aisle. Coming face to face with Train! Even worse, a DOZEN A-TRAINS! Side by side! It’s a magazine rack. A-Train onthe cover of US WEEKLY. H smiles, hugging a chirpy BALD CANCER KID beneath the head “MAKING WISHES COME TRUE.” Hughie, breathing shallow, backs away. Bumping against an entire row of CEREAL. Box drops, Hughie looks. Delicious FROSTED A=TRAINS. A whole fucking ROW of them. WIDE ANGLE. Hughie. Spinning. Drowning. Now sees -- A- Train on CANS of MONSTER ENERGY DRINK. On a CARDBOARD CUT-OUT at the aisle’s end, cerveza in han ‘A-TRAIN CELEBRA CINCO DE MAYO.’ A-Train, A-Train, A-Train, A-Train. The guy murdered the love of Hughie’s life. And everyone idolizes the asshole. Hughie’s chest is heaving now. He slides to the floor, ba against the wall. We leave him there -- in the throes of full blown PTSD PANIC ATTACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN off the gleaming, sky-scraping, futuristic SEVEN TOWER. To find -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A LIMO PULLS UP. A ‘Vought’ PAGE opens the door for -- Starlight. Followed by her Mother. They gape up at the Tower. At the CROWD of SCREAMING FANS behind the ropes. A GROUP OF MEN and WOMEN APPROACH -- Starlight’s ENTOURAGE

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Ashley, I’m your publicist. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER (holy shit!) A publicist.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Hi. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: This is Rachel, hair and make-up. Luis is your stylist. Dan and Rich, they’re from your marketing and social media teams. Amy’sS»your PA, you need anything, you ask hers, You two thirsty? Amy!

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: (to the group) I'm -- hi. “No, we're good.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Well, Amy’s gonna get, your Mom to her seat, but you, you‘re with me, we're gonna be late! Starlight is dizzy already. A heady whirlwind of glamor. Waves happily»at her Mother as she’s whisked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight’s Mother, awed, takes her VIP front row seat am a packed HOUSE of INVESTORS. A SPOTLIGHT illuminates Vice-President of Hero Management Julia Stillwell. Confident. Gregarious. She pitches the crowd before a stage-wide video screen -- ‘VOUGHT INTERNATIONAL: 2017 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDER Along with alternating images of their various projects. Movie Posters. Theme Parks. Toys. Cartoons. Vought makes Marvel look like a corn-studded piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: +..net income is up 14 percent, our latest film “G-Men: World War” grossed just shy of 1.7 billion world-wide. This fall we break ground on our newest theme park outside of Paris. Our branding opportunities are limitless. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a good time to be in the Superhero Business. The crowd applauds -- Julia holds up her hand, goes since

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: But as we all know, none of that matters. Because job one? Is managing, supporting, and advising the brave heroes who put themselves in harm’s way each and every day. For us. Take a look. The spotlight snuffs out. Inspirational music swells, as slickly packaged P.R. video begins on the huge screen. TO LEE JONES got paid a shit-ton to narrate.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Vought International. Handling the Business of Superheroes, so Superheroes can handle their Business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight. Flanked by her team. Crowded elevator going up up and away. Make-up artist primps Starlight on the fly.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You know, you’re doing really great so far...

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I haven't done anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Exactly. And you're already up 2 and a half.points with Midwesterners and Conservative Christians in 18 to 49. I saw your audition, by the way. The ‘saving the world’ thing. Really brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I meant it.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: That’s why we love you. So. You ready for your life to change? Starlight’s overwhelmed but elated. Yeah. She thinks so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video continues. Classy Ken Burns style visuals. Firs we see black and white photos of a Captain America-like h named SOLDIER BOY. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «-.1944. Soldier Boy. The first Superpowered human. To be followed by more. Dozens more. Men and women born -- blessed -- with extraordinary genetic abilities. Jonas Salk famously called them ‘a leap forward in evolution.’ No one’s quite sure why it happened, but thank God it did. Multiple IMAGES of HEROES flit past.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Until, of course, the apex. The pinnacle. The formation of the most popular Superhero Team the world’s ever seen. THE SEVEN. (crowd goes wild) Led by -- not just a hero -- but an American institution.« As»powerful as he is humble. Ladies and gentlemen -- the HOMELANDER. Now the crowd goes WILD. ,As a SPOTLIGHT appears in the center of stage -- revealing the HOMELANDER. Live and in flesh! Giving an aw-shucks wave.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And please welcome the rest of the Seven! QUEEN MAEVE. BLACK NOIR. THE DEEP. A-TRAIN. TRANSLUCENT. Spotlights, BLAZE ON beside the Homelander. Introducing e hero, in person. (Translucent is negative space in a suit an invisible man). CLOSE ON STARLIGHT. Being shuffled out onto the stage by STAGE MANAGER. In shadow. Her moment’s about to come... IN THE CROWD. Her Mother’s as nervous as she is.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And finally -- unless you live under a rock, you’ve heard that after a long, distinguished career with the Seven, the Lamplighter has retired. A grateful nation bids him a fond farewell. Adoring images of THE LAMPLIGHTER, along with Marines saluting and children beaming their ‘thank you's.’

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY LEE JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But now -- as we turn towards the future -- we introduce the newest member of the Seven. Please welcome -- STARLIGHT. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The WHITE HOT SPOTLIGHT SNAPS onto Starlight. She smiles, jittery, waves. Drinks in the crashing waves of applause. Beside all of her idols. Locks eyes with -- IN THE CROWD. Her Mother. This is literally the single be moment of Mom’s life.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: (stepping out) The Seven, ladies and gentlemen! How about ‘em!? The thunderous clapping continues, as well as a universe iPhone flashbulbs. Starlight can’t help but steal glances the Homelander. The Deep leans over, whispers to her, charming, disarming.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: (re: Homelander) I know. It’s kinda like sharing a stage with God, right? But you wanna know something? He chews. with his mouth open. Spits little bits of salad right at you. Starlight smiles at the-Deep. Grateful to have someone br all this back down to,earth.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I just«<-+ I mean -- I.can’t believe I’m really, here.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: Hey. You’re here because you’re meant to be here.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: ...thank»you.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: (warm empathy) Look, I remember my first day, it’s a lot to take in. But we’ll show you the ropes. Starlight nods at him, grateful. Turns back to twinkling flashbulbs and raw, uncut adoration. This is all of her wildest, most secret dreams come true... off this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV. From across the street. We see Hughie, through the window, downcast as he upsells some equipment. REVEAL -- we're in a boat of a Cadillac. Behind the wheel A black-trench-coated MAN. This is BILLY BUTCHER (40). (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Enigmatic, he reaches into his GLOVE COMPARTMENT. Tugs ou CIGAR BOX. Opens it, revealing -- A PILE of FAKE IDENTIFICATION CARDS. All with his picture NYPD, FDNY, NSA, DEA, ATF, DHS, some foreign CARDS. He shuffles through them, before choosing an FBI ID. Perfect Goes without saying -- who the HOLY FUCK is Butcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TELEVISION SCREEN. ACCESS HOLLYWOOD. Some b-roll footag of Starlight, waving shy to the crowd at the Vought stockholder meeting.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE MORALES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...and how does newest Seven member Starlight keep her beach-ready bod? The answer might surprise you... Hughie. Before a CUSTOMER. He doesn’t notice the TV --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ...no, you want. the carbon cables. Cost more, but they conduct electricity way better -- When the BELL over the door RINGS. Hughie jerks his head illogically hoping against hope that Robin walks through door. Of course, she doesn’t. \Instead, he spots -- Butcher. Strolling ins He inspects a section of NANNY-CAM Hughie steps up --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You interested in a nanny cam? We're running a special on Vimtag... Butcher looks up. He’s got a blue collar BRITISH ACCENT. lot like Michael Caine.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Tell me. How many nannies go around shakin’ their babies, d’you reckon?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: A good, hard shake. Like trynna get ketchup out of a bottle. 1 percent? Less?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Uh, I -- I really don’t know. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: But they sell a coupla billion dollars worth of this shit worldwide. (smirks at Hughie) Goes to show. The bollocks you can make people swallow, if you get ‘em scared enough.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (long beat) Okay. Is there anything I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna piss you about, Hughie. I know what happened to Robin. Fuckin’ diabolical.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: She wasn’t in the street. She was one step off the fuckin’ curb. And you didn’t take the pay-off. Respect that.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (upset now) I said who. the hell are you? How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Butcher’s the name. People call me Billy. I was thinkin’ we could have a bit of a chat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN ON: the FBI CARD. Hughie inspects it -- Hughie. Butcher. Pass more and more pedestrians, as they near the neon atomic blast of Times Square...

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You’re a Fed? You don’t sound like a Fed.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I can’t fuckin’ immigrate? There’s a big green crumpet out in the harbor that says different.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You don’t look like one, either.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Oh? What do I look like? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Like a Columbine shooter. Butcher smirks. Hughie’s got spark. He nods at the ID, which we know is fake --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Well, it’s right there in black an’ white. But if you wanna give a looksie up me bum to be sure, you go right ahead.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Um. So what, exactly, can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: It’s what I can do for you, my son. Help you get payback for yer girl. (off Hughie) You ain’t alone, Hughie, happens a lot more than you think. Supes, lose over a hundred people a year to collateral damage --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: That can’t be true. (off Butcher) That’s true?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: It’s not that they ain’t strong, it’s that they don’t care. We’re just ants to them.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: C'mon.» It’d be all over the news, people’dbe.screaming bloody murder.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Might be the odd mention now an’ again, like with Robin. But there’s a lot more they don’t tell you -- that gets swept under the rug --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: It ain’t obvious? He holds his hand out. WIDE SHOT. TIMES SQUARE. 50 foot high SCREENS: Wahlberg-esque HERO reclines in his Calvin Klein whiteys. A-Train in a NIKE SHOE spot. A MOVIE: Begins.” The VOUGHT STORE. Tourists take their a shirtless, tighty- “Tek-Knight photos with cardboard hero cut-outs. Superheroes are inescapable -- pretty much like the actual Times Square. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: The movie tickets, an’ the lobbyists, an’ the fuckin’ shoes. But mostly, people like that cozy feeling Supes give ‘em. You got someone to swoop in and save the day for you, then you don’t gotta do it yourself. (then) But you don’t know half the shit they’re up to. It’d curl your hair and straighten your curlies. But that’s where I come in.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Come in... to do what?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Spank the bastards, they ever step too far outta line.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: How do you spank a Supe?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Ways an’ means. You don’t need a fuckin’ glowy green rock to find someone’s weakness. C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: You’1l love it.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hold on. (Butcher stops) Thank you for an extremely... weird conversation. But I’m not sure what this is... and I think I should probably get back.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Mate. Once I go, I’m gone. This is your one an’ only. Besides, what’ve you got to lose, you ain’t already lost? CLOSE ON HUGHIE. Thinking. Off this -- We PAN OFF Hughie and Butcher, to the GLEAMING SEVEN TOWE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight. Taking in the PANORAMIC VIEW from the SEVEN BOARDROOM. 99th floor. Floor to ceiling windows. City lights before her -- like her own private galaxy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pivots to the SEVEN’S FAMOUS CONFERENCE TABLE. Runs h hand over HOMELANDER’S CHAIR. Tastefully embossed with hi name. Like touching the President’s chair. Then... she sees... a CHAIR WITH HER NAME ON IT. Her eyes glisten with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SMALL FISHBOWL. With an exotic fish inside -- electric blue ram cichlid, to be exact. WIDER. Starlight carries the fishbowl down the sleek hallway. Reaches a DOOR. RINGS the bell. No answer. She KNOCKS. The door drifts open. Unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Hello? Deep? INT. THE SEVEN TOWER - DEEP’S ROOM - NIGHT Starlight steps in, tentative. Deep’s apartment is MASSIV All blonde wood and trickling waterfalls and koi ponds an Chinese writing. Not just aquatic -= Zen aquatic.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Just wanted to thank you for being so ki... She feels awkward. Certainly doesn’t want to trespass. She’s about to turn and leave when... She hears an unmistakable GROANING. Sickly. Sounds like someone might be ill? Or in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Hello? She cautiously moves to the sound source. Then steps arou a thick tangle of bamboo trees to see -- THE DEEP. Bites a RUBBER TUBE wrapped tight around his ar As he SHOOTS a syringe of BRIGHT BLUE LIQUID into his vei What the hell is that stuff? A PRETTY GIRL in a PARTY DRESS sprawls next to him. Her e flutter, nearly unconscious. A SYRINGE JUTS from her arm. Deep makes eye contact with Starlight. Who’s horrified --

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: What the FUCK?

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Oh my God, sorry, I’m sorry -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Deep stands. He’s furious. Aggressive. And completely different than the charming hero Starlight met.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: You just walk in??

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: (sputtering) I knocked... your door was... I was just bringing you... She lamely holds out the fishbowl.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: Turn around. Forget this ever happened. But Starlight notices the girl. A thick gob of spittle at the side of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Is she... okay? That sends Deep over the edge. SUDDENLY, with SUPER STRENGTH, he SHOVES Starlight against the wall! She drops the FISHBOWL. CRASH! Scary, Deep clamps his hand around Starlight’s neck. His forehead veins are popping, he’s so pissed. (It’s a roid- like reaction to the mysterious blue drug). DEEP. Who the HELL asked you                        !

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: (small, scared) ...I think» she needs help...

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re the fucking hero? Please. You’re here cause we needed a few more points with Evangelicals. There’s a dozen blonde cunts that fit the bill. You're nobody. (then) You breathe a word of this to anyone? You’re out. For good. The fuck back to Iowa. We clear? CLOSE ON STARLIGHT. Just staring at the dying exotic fish FLOPPING ABOUT on the floor. Does she fight back? Make a stand? A long beat... No. She doesn’t. She does what she needs to do.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: Of course. I won’t tell anybody. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A long beat. Frenzied face to frightened face. Until -- He lets her go. She beats a HASTY RETREAT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles out the door. Then stops. Presses her back against the wall, out of breath. It takes every fiber of her being not to cry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back alley. A SERVICE ENTRANCE behind a tall, ornate, old money downtown building. Butcher strides to the door, Hughie in tow. KNOCKS on it. Beat. A NERVOUS SECURITY GUARD answers (dark coat, tie, BADGE). Hughie watches this exchange, curious.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck, man.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: This is the last time, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: It’s always the last time. This is fucking police brutality. (nods, inside) You know what these people’1ll do to me, they catch me letting you in?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: (cool, even) Not even half of what I’1l do, if you don’t. Butcher smiles but never breaks eye contact. It’s unsettling. Message received. The Security Guard hands over two SECURITY BADGES. Butche gives one to Hughie.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Did he just say you’re a cop?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Cop, Fed, it’s all the same to that cunt. Here, put this on.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? But Butcher just strides inside. Uneasy, and now a bit suspicious, Hughie follows -- THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! CLOSE ON HUGHIE as the ELEVATOR DOOR OPENS. His jaw hits the floor. As he takes in -- A PRIVATE CLUB. Dark. Thumping music. Lots of SIDE ROOMS and various nooks and crannies. AND SUPERHEROES. Male and female. All shapes and sizes an colors. PARTYING THEIR COSTUMED ASSES OFF. The female heroes are having as much rambunctious fun as the men. It like Studio 54 -- multiplied by 54. One FEMALE HERO with a tiara tightens her FLUORESCENT ROP S&M style, around a HOG-TIED NAKED MAN. He happily begs t be spanked, she happily obliges. Two HEROES TELEKINETICALLY HURL a CHAIR over a ducking WAITER, SMASHING it through the window, as if they were Whitesnake on the Sunset Strip. Hughie and Butcher step over a burly STEEL-SKINNED SUPERH passed out on the floor in a pool of his owny)sick. WAITE try to drag him away, but he’s far too heavy. Hughie is absolutely gobsmacked. Then spots --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s Captain Fantastic. The ‘Capes ‘for Christ’ guy. Holds those anti-gay rallies. POV. The stretchy Superhero we saw on TV in the opener is ecstasy, wrapped around THREE MEN in G-STRINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: And now he’s the meat in the Manwich. Fuckin’ hypocrite. Like Bill Cosby in spandex. They pass a HERO, his hair a SHIMMERING WAVE of FIRE, qui and desperately crying to himself. Who knows why.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Okay. So this is more than I ever, ever wanted to see. I’m leaving now before one of them tries to have sex with me. Or kill me. Or both.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Not yet. Off Hughie -- he follows Butcher into a back room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anxious Security Guard checks the coast is clear. The lets Butcher and Hughie into the SECURITY ROOM. A wall fu of monitors recording every room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Where’s the vid you rang me about? The Security Guard reluctantly hands Butcher a MEMORY STI Butcher plugs it into a COMPUTER.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Oi. Hughie. Monitor 2. Butcher fiddles a knob. Turning up the AUDIO. THE MONITOR. Time-stamped security cam footage of a BACK ROOM. A-TRAIN. Throws back shots like it’s his job.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: A-Train’s -- here?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Was. This is from last night. THE MONITOR. Suddenly, A-Train looks 0.S., as --

dialogues.speaker: BIG GAME, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A-Train. Your girlfriend’s here. She's pissed. A HERO -- BIG GAME =- enters. He carries two MANNEQUIN AR

dialogues.speaker: BIG GAME
dialogues.text: She wants to know why you ran through her the other night. I mean, she just went to pieces. HUGHIE. His jaw clenches. Butcher looks at him, sympathetic. Knows»how hard this is for him.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m not the one that threw a Volvo at that carjacker, without realizing there was a fucking kid strapped inside.

dialogues.speaker: BIG GAME
dialogues.text: Screw you, man, that sucked. (sucks back a shot) I had to go fucking cry on Diane Sawyer. Pointed, because A-Train just did the same --

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: Boy, can’t imagine what that’s like, asshole. Big Game sticks the mannequin arms into A-Train’s crotch. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BIG GAME
dialogues.text: Aw, look, she wants to make up.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, baby, but when I get inside a girl, I get inside a girl. CLOSE ON HUGHIE. Quietly enraged --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ...they’re laughing. Like she’s a joke. They’re fucking laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Question is, what are you gonna do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vought Vice-President Julia Stillwell skims down the Towe hallway with the Vought Lawyer -- same guy from before -- hurries to keep up. He’s nervous -- shejis miles above hi paygrade. But she never loses her corporate geniality.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It’s Doug?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Doug. Friedman. Ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Doug, I appreciate you trying to low- ball this Hugh Campbell, but can we settle out the A-Train thing? I mean, 25 thousand? I got a bigger shoe budget.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure it’s about the money with this guy.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: If you quit nickel and diming him? It’ll be about the money. Just get it off our plate, please. Without breaking stride, Julia glides into the boardroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she grins at the MAYOR of BALTIMORE (50), sitting a the table. He nods to a GLOSSY PIC of the HOMELANDER. Autographed “To Mason: Reach for the Sky! Best, Homelande

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Thanks for this. My kid’s gonna lose his mind. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Our pleasure, Mr. Mayor. Just don’t sell it on-line.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Alright. Tell me what you’re thinking.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: (into her presentation) Steve, look. Baltimore’s a beautiful town. Those crab cakes at Faidley’s? Change your life. But you've got a problem. Homicide rates are up, what, 62%? Your police aren’t closing cases, you're on the verge of needing a federal life-line.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: You don’t need to salt my wounds.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: No disrespect. But you know police tanks rolling down main street won't play on the 6 o’clock news. How'd it work out,for Ferguson? Or Baton Rouge?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Cut to the chase, Julia. Who are you proposing? She clicks,a. remote. On the flat-screen, PHOTOS of a handsome, Will Smith-like BLACK SUPERHERO appear.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Nubian Prince. Fits your population’s demo, but not too militant -- Caucasians love him too, approval’s around 68 percent. We’re offering a 3 year exclusive contract. Plus our full PR support. And we'll throw in 9 and a half points of the merchandising.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: I thought he was in Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: We're thinking about making a move. We've come to you first.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: How much? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: 300 million a year. I know it’s a tough swallow, but we both know your city needs a hero.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: (beat, contemplates) Look. I have the City Council up my ass on every fucking dime of the budget. You make it 200 million, I can sell it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Can't do it. We have Atlanta waiting in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: (beat) I think maybe you can.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Oh? And why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: (leans forward) Because I happen to know about Compound V. Stillwell betrays only the merest twitch.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. What’s ‘Compound V?’

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: The) kinda rumor that can really tarnish those heroes of yours. And no one wants that -- people need heroes. )Now. I can make sure it stays a rumor. You know I’ma friend. But friendship cuts both ways. What is he talking about? We’re not sure. But Stillwell only gives him the most pleasant of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Sorry, Steve, I just don’t know what you're talking about. 300 million’s the price. Or we go to Atlanta. Off Stillwell. She might not be a superhero, but she sure knows how to wear a mask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of toilet stalls. And Starlight. At a sink. Stares herself in the mirror. Her mascara runs. She’s been cryin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She inspects the NECK BRUISING from where the Deep grabbe her. It’s already turning an angry purple. When... QUEEN MAEVE enters. Heads to the sink beside Starlight to reapply some make-up from a small clutch. Starlight sneaks glances at Queen Maeve. Humiliated to be meeting her idol in such circumstances. Subtly tries to cover her neck bruises with her hand. When Queen Maeve pivots to Starlight. Long beat. Is Maeve going to say something? But then -- Queen Maeve gently pulls Starlight’s hand away from her n Inspects the bruising. Then... Maeve reaches into her clutch, pulls out a bottle skin tone CONCEALER. Holds it up to Starlight’s neck. Wit compassion --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MAEVE
dialogues.text: I think this is your color. Implying that Starlight should cover up the bruise. Maybe even implying that Maeve"s been there herself. Then -- Queen Maeve pivots for the door. Calls out, witho looking back.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MAEVE
dialogues.text: Translucent, you’re such a fucking perv. Queen Maeve exits. Beat. Then... Translucent the invisibl man MATERIALIZES, naked, spying on Starlight from the cor

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT
dialogues.text: Uh. I/lbe== I'll just go. He walks sheepishly out. Off Starlight, painfully learning the old adage -- never, ever meet your heroes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dive bar of your dreams. All dark wood and character. Hughie sits at a private BOOTH, beer in front of him. Butcher across, nursing a soda water (he never drinks). Hughie. Digesting what he just saw. Quiet. PISSED.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: They're -- all like that? All of ‘em? Even the Homelander? Butcher skips the tiniest half beat. Voice goes the tinie bit flat. Something’s going on here, but we don’t dwell. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Homelander’s the exception. Doesn't drink, smoke. Fuckin’ saint. But the rest? Yeah, pretty much. (then) Here, have a shufti at this -- From a MANILA FOLDER, Butcher removes some densely printe PAPERS, spreads them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Police log, night of Robin’s death. Couple bar fights, some cars got nicked. Know what’s not in there? No banks triggering any alarms. No one charged with robbery at Central Booking. A-Train stopped two bank robbers, my arse. Someone’s covering somethin’ up.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Covering up --.what? We re-play FLASHES of Hughie, Robin and A-Train from the opening... to illustrate Butcher’s case...

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Whatever A-Train was doing that night. You»said he looked scared. But what’s he got to be scared of? What did he mean, ‘he can’t stop?’ And what was in that bag? All sounds bleedin’ dodgy to me. (off Hughie) So the big question is: where was he runnin’?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Or who was he running from? Butcher regards Hughie. Impressed. Smart.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Yeah. True. Good point. (beat) Figure that out, we’ll have the fucker. Got a nose for this shit, and I’m tellin’ you, I can smell it. Hughie stares at the reports. Feels emboldened.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Okay. How can I help? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Ring Vought. Tell ‘em you’1ll take the money, sign the NDA. But only if A-Train’s there in person when you do.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Wait, I don’t... why would I...?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I dunno. Say you gotta shake his hand. For closure. They’ll invite you into the Seven Tower to meet him. Past their security. And then, my son, you are gonna stick a bug in the place. We’l1l have a listen, really see what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: So, sorry -- you want me to go into the Seven tower? By myself? And plant -- a bug? Like I’m fucking James Bond?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Hughie. Why do you think I came to you in the first.place? For the good of me health? Again, Hughie’s breathing grows.shallow. He pales. Starti to have another PTSD attack.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You gotta come with me.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: No waythey give me a pass.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What if something goes wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: It won’t.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Really comforting. And easy for you to say, as you sit out here on your “arse.” I mean, you’re FBI, if you’re fucking FBI, get a warrant, why do you need me --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: (a bald lie, of course) I got a warrant. But that place is fire-walled and untappable and locked up tighter than a nun’s clunge. I couldn’t sneak in meself, not in a million years. But you can. Now calm down. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Calm? You didn’t see A-Train, covered in Robin’s -- and I’m supposed to shake his hand and smile? These people kill fucking kids in fucking Volvos on, like, a random Tuesday, what do you think they’1l do to me if they catch me?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: We've never had a go at the Seven before, not like this --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I said NO!

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: (beat) You saw him on that video. You heard what he said about her.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (quieter, sadder) I just -- I can’t» I’m just gonna fuck it up. You won’t have your bug and I’1l be dead. I’m not like you. Hughie stands. Exits. Off Butcher. He doesn’t look upset. He smirks, confident, sips from his club soda. As if he expected this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butcher. Emerging from the bar. Calmly strolling. When -- far overhead --,A HERO SOARS through the night sk lit by city lights»Followed by ANOTHER. It’s that last on who's got Butcher’s attention. He’s pretty far away, but eagle eyed viewers might recognize him as the HOMELANDER. WE CREEP IN ON BUTCHER. Stops. Just staring up. Wearing his own stoic mask. Until --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna fuckin’ have you. You cunt. WIDER. Butcher’s just another New Yorker. When... a BLACK SUV cruises past.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The MAYOR of BALTIMORE. The one who mentioned ‘Compound V whatever that is. He rides in the back. On his cell.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Ms. Stillwell. Wasn’t sure I'd hear from you. THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell’s smile is tight. She doesn’t like to acquiesce

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Alright, Steve. This fucking chafes, but we can go down to 230 million for Nubian Prince.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: I think that’s very reasonable, Julia. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Well, like you said, friendship cuts both ways.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Yes, it does. You have my word. There are secrets and scandals between these lines. But w don’t know what they are. Yet. Off the Mayor, seemingly winning the negotiation -- INT. HUGHIE’S FAMILY APARTMENT - QUEENS - NEXT DAY ON THE TV. ELLEN. “Eternally upbeat. She sits with a VISIBLE (and clothed) TRANSLUCENT -- He rolls up his sleeve, lifts his,bare arm. Which SHIMMER then seemingly DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT
dialogues.text: .»»-Mo, I don’t actually vanish, my skin turns into this -- carbon meta- material -- that bends light. Like an invisibility cloak.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: But just to be clear -- you have to be completely naked, right? The audience OOHS and AAHS -- Hughie. Sits on the couch. Numb, listless, defeated. Next to his wheezing Father. His Mom sets a plate of pizza rol on the coffee table. HUGHIE’S MOM Here you go, honey. Pizza rolls with ketchup. Hughie picks one up. Hesitates. Somehow, eating one means acquiescing to his sad suburban life. When -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HUGHIE’S DAD (finally speaks) 30 years at that One Hour Martinizing. Cost me a lung, and what’d I get for it? And you wanna take on Vought? It’s like trynna take on a mountain. Take the money, Hughie. We’re lucky to get it. PUSH IN ON HUGHIE. Holding that pizza roll. Looking at hi Dad. Is he really gonna give up? Give in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight -- dressed for the first time in CIVILIAN CLOTH As her secret identity: mild-mannered Annie. She strolls through the park, phone to her ear. INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight’s Mother makes a bedazzled)PRESS SCRAPBOOK of a her daughter’s recent newspaper clippings. STARLIGHT’S MOTHER ++.SO. How amazing is it?» What’s the Homelander like?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE/STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: I... he’s busy, I haven’t really met him yet.) Look, Mom, I gotta tell you what happened... STARLIGHT’S MOTHER Oh, I almost forgot. I was playing Mahjong with Judy and Elaine, and they were going on and on about how wonderful Starlight is. Starlight this and)Starlight that. I know, I know, I gotta protect your secret identity, but I would love to see the looks on their faces if I told them it was you. (beat) Anyway, what were you gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (long beat) Just that everything’s great. Just how I dreamed. Mom, I gotta go. WITH ANNIE. She hangs up. Sits on a park bench. Stares up at -- the radiant SEVEN TOWER. This isn’t at all what she thought it would be. Her dreams are dying on the vine.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but... are you okay? HUGHIE. On a bench beside her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Both of them, watching the Tower. For very different reasons. She wipes a tear, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m fine. Hughie pulls a CLOTH HANDKERCHIEF out of his pocket. Crosses to Annie. Holds it out. She gives him an odd look. After what she’s been through, she’s not ready to accept a kindness from a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (self-conscious) I know. Cloth handkerchief. I’m not really 90 years old, it’s just my Dad was in dry cleaning, he insists I carry -- never mind. Sorry to bother you. Hughie pivots away. Annie looks after him -- the guy’s ju trying to offer a little, compassion in a cruel world.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No, wait. Actually, thank you, I'd... appreciate it. Hughie hands her the handkerchief. She dries her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Just having a bad day, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. Work thing or life thing? Beat. No one’s been willing or able to listen to Annie. Now, finally, this stranger is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Work thing. You?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Life thing. They sit in silence. Another long beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You know how you -- you have this image of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Mine’s not so hot... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’m sure that’s not true. (then) I always thought I was... strong, you know? Like, made of steel. A fighter. (then) But then there I was... I needed to fight. Had to. But -- I didn’t. Kept my eyes down, mouth shut, did what it took to keep my job. Turns out I’m not who I thought I was. And I think -- I think I just wanna go home. Hughie gives her a long, serious look.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I didn’t mean to dump all that on --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s not that. It’s just, I can relate, I’m -- long story. (off Annie) Listen. Do you like your job?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s the only thing I ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: And it’s a good job? You don’t get kids hooked on smokes or anything?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s)a great job. I could help a lot of, people. CLOSE ON HUGHIE. A flash of vulnerability. Thinking of hi fear of A-Train. Thinking of Robin.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Thing is, I -- I knew this girl. Who'd just -- charge headfirst into everything. Me, I backed away from everything, I was... I dunno... scared of falling or failing. But she'd say ‘just cause you fall on your ass, doesn’t mean you gotta stay there.’ (then) So I guess I’d say the same to you. Pardon my french, but fuck those fuckers. Don’t give ‘em the satisfaction. You can still be a fighter -- just get up and fight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gives Hughie a long, thoughtful look. Whoever this gu is, he told her just what she needed to hear, just when s needed to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like a smart girl. You should take her advice, too. Hughie glances at her. She’s right.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I’m Hughie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie. Off their handshake -- off a respite of tenderness amidst usual madness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUTCHER. Sits at the bar. Stares into his soda. When -- A BEAUTIFUL REDHEAD, 30, approaches him. Egged on by her booth-full of friends.

dialogues.speaker: REDHEAD
dialogues.text: Hi. Hello. So I’m sure this is a terrible idea, but my friends have dared me -- to buy you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: You're right. (then) It is a terrible idea.

dialogues.speaker: REDHEAD
dialogues.text: (ouch) Oh, uh, okay. Sorry. Crash and burn. She goes. Who is this guy? When Hughie ENTERS. Passing the Redhead. To Butcher --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hey. Hoping I’d find you here. Butcher smiles to himself. It was only a matter of time before Hughie showed up.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Boy, this is a shocker. Not expectin’ to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Let’s get A-Train. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: (feigns reluctance) I dunno, mate. How do I know you ain’t gonna leg it like last night? How do I know you got the bottle?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I’ve got the -- I don’t know what ‘bottle’ means in that context, but I’m in, man, I wanna do this.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: You gonna see this through? To the end?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Right, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie, on his cell. Butcher, listening.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ...Mr. Friedman, got your message, and wow, 75k is -> life changing. I'll sign whatever you want. I just -- I need one more thing. An apology from A-Train.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: He already apologized.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: No. He gave his regrets. And his sympathys..0n TV. But I want him to look me in the eye and say he’s sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ll ask. But I’m telling you, Hugh, the answer’s gonna be no. Click. Hughie hangs up. To Butcher --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Don’t think they’re going for it.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Oh yes, they will. And in the Tower, too. They’re not gonna wanna air this shit in public. Off Butcher’s knowing smirk -- THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-Train. With Julia Stillwell. Having a quiet side-bar in the corner as the other members of the Seven enter the BOARDROOM for their official meeting.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: No. No way.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: We gotta put this behind us, it’s five minutes out of your day.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: So some dude can blubber all over me? I’m -- not good in situations like that. No. Julia steps forward. Her genial smile never leaves her fa

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: You know. The Blue Bolt shaved another point off his mile. He’s almost as fast as you. Impressive, especially someone that young.

dialogues.text: The hell is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Look, I’m just trying to help. You know I love you, but I’m only one person in this company. You don’t want the guys upstairs to start bitching that you’re difficult. Like they did with the Lamplighter. Off A-Train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butcher. Hughie. At the bar. Waiting. When -- RING! Hughie’s cell. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hello? Yes, Mr. Friedman...? He gives Butcher a look. They’re in. Butcher knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlight. Back in uniform. Alone at the sink. She stares at herself in the mirror. Suppressing her fear and anger. Fuck ‘em. She won’t give ‘em the satisfaction. THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.text: Starlight enters. The Seven have gathered, a modern-day Knights of the Oblong Conference Table. Homelander at the head. Julia Stillwell observes in the corner.

dialogues.text: (pure Costner) Starlight. Don’t wanna be late for your first official meeting. I had a whole welcome speech planned.

dialogues.text: Sorry, Sir.
