dialogues.text: Homelander is fine.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP
dialogues.text: We were beginning to wonder if you’d even show up. She glares at the Deep, defiant. She’s literally got a lo to kill and wants to use it.) But she restrains herself.

dialogues.speaker: STARLIGHT
dialogues.text: (dry) . Oh, no, I’m excited to be here. I’m on pins and needles. The Deep. Glares at)her, surprised. Didn’t expect this mu grit from Starlight. As a floating pair of reading glasses in the next chair peruses some paperwork --

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT
dialogues.text: ...Can we»get back to this please, this is a serious crime. (then) Copyright infringement of our brands, individually and collectively, is costing Vought 1.2 billion per year. That’s money out of our pockets. We’ve all got, what, four points each? As they ramble on... Starlight. She acts calm, strong. Bu she’s wearing a mask.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: Fuck. You've got four points?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN MAEVE
dialogues.text: And clearly, better lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELANDER
dialogues.text: Hey. C’mon. Stop. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone shuts up. Turns to the Homelander. He commands unwavering respect --

dialogues.speaker: HOMELANDER
dialogues.text: (pure Clooney) What’s Starlight gonna think, listening to us haggle over nickels? We're the Seven for God’s sake. Now what I want to hear -- is who you saved this week. Black Noir, let’s start with you -- The guy really is an omnipotent Boy Scout. Off this -- EXT. THE SEVEN TOWER/INT. BUTCHER’S CAR - NIGHT PAN DOWN off the SEVEN TOWER to reveal -- Butcher’s car. behemoth of a Caddy. INSIDE THE CAR. Hughie, anxious,as hell. Looks in the bac seat -- notices some STRAY DOG TOYS. »Bright, cutesy, squ rubber animals. Seems out of character for Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: You have a dog?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: No. Butcher doesn’t elaborate further. On Hughie -- umkay.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Give us your phone. Hughie complies. Butcher pops it out of its case. Then pulls out a BUG» As wide and thin as a silver dollar.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Security won't find it, or the X- ray. Butcher hides the bug in Hughie’s phone case, clicks the phone back in place OVER it --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Now, what they’1l probably do is take you to the boardroom. Give it a minute, say you need a crap. Take out the bug when you’re in the bog. Glue’s there on one side, see? Go back, stick it under the boardroom table, that’s that. Hughie’s heart is racing. Commencing another panic attack He starts spluttering --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: That’s that? Kinda seems like -- a lot, actually. What if -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Hughie. Two choices. One: go an’ whine to a shrink for the rest of your life, pop some Klonopin, maybe punch an A-Train doll. Two: stop bein’ such a cunt. What do you say? Off Hughie. He swallows nervously -- a major effort -- an climbs out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie. GRIPPING his phone. We hear his THUMPING HEART. A he enters the hypermodern lobby. Approaches Ashley the publicist, surgically attached to her Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Hi -- are you Ashley? I’m Hughie Campbell...? Ashley smiles, thin. She’s used to working with Gods. Not mere mortals.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Follow me, Mr. Campbell. Ashley leads Hughie through the SECURITY CHECKPOINT. He anxiously flits his eyes at -- POV’s. HEAVY FUCKING HARDWARE.) SECURITY GUARDS with semi automatics. SURVEILLANCE CAMS mounted everywhere. A stutter-step, as he drops his PHONE through the x-ray machine. Hughie walks through the metal detector, eyes on the X-RAY TECH. Who... shit, SQUINTS at the monitor...

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY TECH
dialogues.text: Sir, may )I.examine your phone?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Uh -- sure. Hughie’s about to have a heart attack. As the X-Ray Tech carefully pores over the phone. Turns it around. Is he gonna pop it from its case? Find the bug? This seems to last FUCKING FOREVER. Hughie sweats bullets. Until --

dialogues.speaker: X-RAY TECH
dialogues.text: Have a “Super” day. The Tech hands it over. Hughie collects his phone, follow Ashley to the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley opens the door to the boardroom. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Wait here, please. A-Train will be with you shortly. She's already off before Hughie can say thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie. Alone. Sitting at the table in the imposing, cavernous room. Clenching his phone. He stares at it, tries to will himself not to sweat. Is t his moment? Should he go to the bathroom now? While no on is here, no one is watching? BEEP! The desk INTERCOM comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Won't be long, Mr. Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I need to -- go to the bathroom. Hello? But the intercom has already clicked off. Hughie. Takes a beat. Takes a breath. Grips his phone. Steels himself. He-can do this. This is it. Stands up. Heads to the door. Reaches for the knob -- The door suddenly swings open! And A-TRAIN enters, follow by Ashley, various HANDLERS, and Doug Friedman -- who beg to lay out the documents on the table. CLOSE ON HUGHIE.. Face-to-face with A-Train. Nose to nose Tete-a-tete. The source of all his misery. Anger. Anxiety

dialogues.speaker: DOUG FRIEDMAN
dialogues.text: Just to be clear, A-Train’s apology isn’t an admission of any sort of culpability whatsoever, do you understand? Hughie manages a nod. The Lawyer gives A-Train the okay.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: (a sullen 3rd grader) Hey, man. I’m sorry what happened to your girlfriend. Alright? A-Train reaches out his hand to shake. CLOSE ON HUGHIE. Wide-angle, like in the bodega. Breathin shallow. Heart pounding. Eyes wide. He’s about to plunge into another PTSD attack! He glances down at his PHONE, which he grips, white-knuckled. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Lawyer and the Publicist trade concerned looks. A-Tra looks down at Hughie’s phone, too.

dialogues.speaker: A-TRAIN
dialogues.text: Buddy. You okay? Hughie’s gonna blow it! A cringe-worthy beat. Another! But then... he takes a deep breath. Pulls himself togethe Into the AMAZING SALESMAN HE IS. Firmly shakes hands. Cool as shit.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Fine. I appreciate the apology. But accidents happen, right? And after all, you were saving the world.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (sighs with relief) Okay, thank you, Mr. Campbell.»Now if you’ll excuse us, a crime- fighter’s work is never done, but Douglas here will stay behind, get you those documents... A-Train, Ashley, and the various handlers beat a hasty retreat. Leaving Doug Friedman behind, who holds out a pe

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Where’s your, bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie enters, heads into a stall. INSIDE THE STALL. Heysits on the toilet. Wrenches his pho from its case. But if your case is anything like mine, that’s never, ever easy. He tugs a bit too hard -- The phone CLACKS to the floor! Even worse, so does the BU Which spins like a quarter before landing on the linoleum It’s still in the stall, but right beneath the door, in p view if anyone was looking for it -- Hughie. Shit. Which escalates into FUCK when -- The door opens and SOMEONE ENTERS. Hughie freezes. He can tell who it is, he only spots boots. But we can see -- It’s STARLIGHT. She moves to the sink, stares in the mirr gets her game face back on. If she saw Hughie, she’d recognize him! But... she doesn’t see him, and he never sees her. She exits. Hughie breathes a sigh of relief. Near miss. Snags the bug and the phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He exits the stall. Exits the bathroom. But we hold a BEA As TRANSLUCENT materializes in the bathroom corner. Naked He was just gonna perv out again, but instead, he saw the whole damn thing. He frowns. What the hell? Off this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughie exits the lobby. Flush with victory. Struts down t street like fucking Travolta. Up to Butcher’s car. Butcher gives him a curious look. Well? Hughie breaks int a wide grin. Nods. He did it. He actually did it! EXT. BRYMAN AUDIO VISUAL/INT. BUTCHER’S CAR - NIGHT Butcher pulls up in front of Hughie’s Electronics Store. Quiet night. No one inside but GARY, the owner. INSIDE THE CAR. Hughie, still pumped with adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: That was awesome.. Staring that asshole down? I get why you dig this job, man <-

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Got its moments.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: But you’re right -- fuck A-Train, fuck -- (finally noticing) What’re we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: How d’you mean? You gotta go back to work, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I -- sorry?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Hughie, you were brilliant. But that’s all I needed you for.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: What? But -- I don’t -- I mean, I can help you, let me help --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: You did help. I got it from here. (a final) Cheers. Beat. Doesn’t seem like Butcher is budging. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Um. Right. Okay. Hughie climbs out, tries to hide his disappointment. He gives Butcher a ‘goodbye’ nod.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, almost forgot -- ever see an asshole tear up 75k? Hughie takes out the VOUGHT CHECK. RIPS it.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: You're a good lad, Hughie. Not all that common in my line of work. Off Hughie, nodding back -- but feels oddly dissatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV. MSNBC. CHRIS HAYES converses with a NATIONAL SECURITY EXPERT. Forever droning talking»heads.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS,HAYES, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ..+-policing cities is a thorny enough issue,as it is, but allowing Superheroes into)national defense? We'd be basically privatizing war...

dialogues.speaker: EXPERT, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, it’s inevitable... IN THE STORE. Gary throws on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: GARY,
dialogues.text: Alright, g’night, Hughie. You’ll lock up? (off Hughie’s nod) I’m still thinking about that raise, you know.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, thanks, Gary. Gary exits. Hughie. Behind the counter. Stares at the TV. Returning to this shitty fucking job, after all that intrigue, feels anti-climactic, both for Hughie and for u But then... ANGLE. Hughie’s back to the door. So he doesn’t see it OPEN. And CLOSE. By ITSELF. He only hears the bell JINGLE

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (as he pivots) Sorry. I’m closing up -- (room's empty) Hello? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A ghostly, disembodied VOICE --

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (twirling) The fuck? Where --

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right in front of you. That silver dollar BUG floats in the air before Hughie.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You think I wouldn’t find this thing?! Hughie barely has time to register surprise, when -- WHAC His head SNAPS to the side from an INVISIBLE PUNCH. Blood flings from the side of his mouth. Oh. Shit. INT. BUTCHER’S CAR/EXT. BACK ALLEY - NIGHT -) CONTINUOUS Butcher. Parked in some,abandoned back alley. Has a LAPTO open on the passenger seat. Listening to the BUG. Which means he’s listening to Hughie.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Please! I don’t know what you’re talking about!

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t give me that, I followed you from the Tower!

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ hell, Hughie, you got yourself made. CLOSE ON BUTCHER. Maybe there’s a wisp of regret flutteri over his face. Then again, maybe not. Guy’s a mystery. From the LAPTOP -- unmistakable sounds of CRASHING GLASS

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Ah, well. Butcher closes the laptop. Sound shuts off. Seemingly washing his hands of the whole sordid business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Hughie is SHOVED BACK into a wall of TV’s. Some CRA to the floor, LIVE WIRES SPARKING! As Hughie gets his ASS KICKED by an invisible man. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who was that guy you were with?! In the car? With admirable bravery, Hughie doesn’t answer -- So he’s THROWN again. CRASH! OUCH!

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who was he?? He put you up to this?

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know! He was just a fucking Uber driver, okay?!

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why’d you plant the bug??

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: ...please... please... We can SEE -- HEAR -- the crunch of glass». As Translucen stalks closer to Hughie. Closer.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Think you can just fuck with us? We're the Seven!) Earth’s Most Mighty! Champions.of the Innocent! This is it. Curtains for Hughie. Fat Lady steps up to the mike, clears her throat, and --

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: BUTCHER'S CAR CAREENS THROUGH THE STORE’S FRONT WINDOW!

dialogues.speaker: SHATTERING THE GLASS. DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HUGHIE
dialogues.text: KNOCKING TRANSLUCENT, CLEAR ACROSS THE ROOM. We can tell, from the CRUNCH of his body on the windshield, from the T against a collapsing shelf of ELECTRONICS. Butcher climbs out of the car. For some reason, he holds sparking CATTLE PROD (stay tuned for why).

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Hughie, run. (Hughie hesitates) Fuckin’ run! Hughie scrambles for the back room of the store -- as But straightens up, pivots to Translucent --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Let him be, you invisible cunt.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I’1l1 tell you who you are. A fuckin’ joke, mate.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLUCENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That so?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Translucent doesn’t even mean ‘invisible,’ you silly twat. It means ‘semi-transparent.’ Butcher LUNGES with the CATTLE PROD. But he misses -- not easy to fight an invisible man. Translucent RIPS the CATTLE PROD out of Butcher’s HAND. Hurls it out of reach. SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HUGHIE. Darting past boxes and equipment, about escape out the back. He opens the door =-— And STOPS. Who is he gonna be? Someone who backs down? Or someone who fights? When he sees, on a rack infront of him -- some CARBON COMPONENT CABLES. He looks at them. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Translucent punches Butcher across the jaw. Then - WHACK! Another hit. Butcher only grins, his teeth red. Then ingeniously SPITS BLOOD in Translucent’s FACE. We se the spattered BLOOD FLOATING IN MID-AIR.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: There you are. Butcher SWINGS -- CONNECTS! But then -- Translucent HITS BACK. Over and over. Harder and harder. It doesn't look good for Butcher. Until -- Suddenly, Hughie is THERE! He PULLS the FIRE ALARM! WATER SPRAYS from OVERHEAD SPRINKLERS -- Revealing TRANSLUCENT. WATER SPLASHES over his BODY!

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: The TV! Butcher glances -- spots a SMASHED TV on the ground, thro sparks into a growing PUDDLE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Butcher gets what Hughie’s saying -- he nods -- UNLOADS a CRUSHING ROUNDHOUSE PUNCH on Translucent -- OOF -- sends bastard flailing back into the sparking WATER -- Which immediately ELECTROCUTES HIM! SPARKS CLIMACTICALLY RIDE UP Translucent’s body. Before he DROPS. Dust-settling beat. The sprinklers stop. Nothing on the floor but a puddle wi the outline of an invisible body in it.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Is he dead? Butcher gives a HARD KICK to Translucent. No noise out of him, no movement --

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Well, he ain’t movin’.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Shit. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: How'd you know electricity bollocksed the cunt? Took me forever to work that one out.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Skin's carbon. Highly conductive. Saw it on ‘Ellen.’

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Nice one, Hughie. Well, come on. We gotta get him in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Wait -- we what?

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Think you just offed a member of the Seven.

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: Me? You hit him!

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Semantics, my son, we’re both in a fucksight a’ trouble. Already, they can hear SIRENS in the distance --

dialogues.speaker: HUGHIE
dialogues.text: No, he attacked us! And you’re -- you're a federal officer! Call the fucking FBI! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Yeah. I ain’t really a fed. Off Hughie -- FUCKING WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARLIGHT. On the ROOF of the Seven Tower -- taking in th infinite constellation of the city below. PUSH IN ON HER. Her anger, her frustration, boiling and churning inside. Rising up. Her eyes begin to glow. Then FLARE. WIDE. The tower’s top floors -- really, all nearby lights FLICKER and BLACK OUT dramatically. Around Starlight. As she draws energy from them. As her eyes BLAZE like FIRE. The other Supes might not see theydefiant spark inside he Not yet. But we sure do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PICTURE. The Homelander. “To Mason: Reach for the Sky! Best, Homelander.” \We've seen this photo before. The Mayor of Baltimore's son MASON, 10. Draws at a desk i bit lip concentration, tries to replicate his beloved Homelander photo with a crayola-on-paper version. His Dad (the Mayor) dozes in a leather chair. Various AID work or sleep. When -- Mason happens to glance out the window. He brightens. His wildest dreams coming true -- POV. ON THE WING. THE HOMELANDER. Proud. Hands on hips. Cape swirling, Zack Snyder-style. He smiles at Mason.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Homelander! Dad, wake up! The Homelander’s here! The Mayor rouses -- what? He heads over to the window, al with the aides. They all grin -- major celeb sighting.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Look at that. What’s he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Did he come to say goodbye? Are you guys friends?? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOYS #101 "Name of the Game" - 10/15/17 (NETWORK DRA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: POV. ON THE WING. The Homelander. Without ever losing his smile, he looks down to the ENGINE -- And FIRES BLINDING RED BEAMS from his eyes! Flaring camer Right at the turbine -- SLICING IT RIGHT OFF --

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOD
dialogues.text: Guess the Mayor lost the negotiation, after all. THE PLAN JOLTS. GOING DOWN. Mason. Open-mouthed in shock and fear. Painfully learning the old adage -- never, ever meet your heroes. Homelander, still genially smiling, gives them a friendly salute. Before FLYING OFF -- STAY WITH THE HOMELANDER. Watching, blank-faced. As the J NOSE DIVES. Plummets down to the»Atlantic. Turns out, Homelander wears a mask, too. »And what’s behi it is psychopathic, unhinged. And all-powerful. Off this
